title: CONTRIBUTING
text: can find rOpenSci developer guide https://devguide.ropensci.org/ happy help point work. follow tidyverse style. can find style guide . committing code, encourage use lintr::lint_file() check nonconformances. use roxygen2 documentation. Please make sure update package latest version update documentation devtools::document(). Use @noRd non exported functions. Please use xml2 package instead XML package. maintainance xml2 much better. Please use lightweight jsonlite package handling JSON. Use utilities webchem::utils.R possible keep function style consistent across package. nice resources! Minimise interaction servers. Use appropriate timeouts. Within test files always include check whether webservice running skip tests . See R/ping.R details. consistency guidelines: Functions query database one database specific identifiers follow naming convention get_*, e.g. function queries ChEBI IDs called get_chebiid(). functions take vector queries return single tibble. Whenever possible functions arguments query, , match, verbose .... first column tibble contain ID-s last contain queries. Invalid queries return row NA-s (apart last element row query ). naming functions query database chemical information start name database, followed functionality, e.g. pc_synonyms() searches synonyms PubChem. functions take vector queries return list responses. Invalid queries return NA. Functions always validate input appropriate. Use match.arg() input validation. Make sure NA confused sodium. Functions retrieve images follow naming convention *_img, e.g. function retrieves images ChemSpider called cs_img(). functions take vector arguments download images user defined directory. keep images memory, implement image processing functionality, return anything console. Functions include arguments dir, overwrite = TRUE verbose = TRUE. dir default value. SMILES strings may use special characters like “#”. URLencode() encode “%23” default, use URLencode(query, reserved = TRUE) instead. ’s important note ’s query encoded like , full url. Print verbose messages. Use httr::message_for_status() webchem_message() functions generate standard messages possible. Wrap function examples interact API \dontrun{}. Avoid using \donttest{}. API longer available defunct exported functions interacting .

title: Getting started with webchem
text: Usually webchem workflow starts translating retrieving chemical identifiers since chemical information databases use internal identifiers. First, covert CAS numbers InChIKey identifiers using Chemical Translation Service. , ’ll use InChiKeys get Pubchem CompoundID numbers, use retrieving chemical properties PubChem. Great, now can retrieve PubChem CIDs. get_*() functions return data frame containing query retrieved identifier. can merge dataset dplyr::full_join()
code: lc50_sub$inchikey <- unlist(cts_convert(lc50_sub$cas, from = "CAS", to = "InChIKey", match = "first", verbose = FALSE)) head(lc50_sub) #>        cas        value                    inchikey #> 4  50-29-3    12.415277 YVGGHNCTFXOJCH-UHFFFAOYSA-N #> 12 52-68-6     1.282980 NFACJZMKEDPNKN-UHFFFAOYSA-N #> 15 55-38-9    12.168138 PNVJTZOFSHSLTO-UHFFFAOYSA-N #> 18 56-23-5 35000.000000 VZGDMQKNWNREIO-UHFFFAOYSA-N #> 21 56-38-2     1.539119 LCCNCVORNKJIRZ-UHFFFAOYSA-N #> 36 57-74-9    98.400000 BIWJNBZANLAXMG-UHFFFAOYSA-N any(is.na(lc50_sub$inchikey)) #> [1] FALSE x <- get_cid(lc50_sub$inchikey, from = "inchikey", match = "first", verbose = FALSE) library(dplyr) lc50_sub2 <- full_join(lc50_sub, x, by = c("inchikey" = "query")) head(lc50_sub2) #>       cas        value                    inchikey  cid #> 1 50-29-3    12.415277 YVGGHNCTFXOJCH-UHFFFAOYSA-N 3036 #> 2 52-68-6     1.282980 NFACJZMKEDPNKN-UHFFFAOYSA-N 5853 #> 3 55-38-9    12.168138 PNVJTZOFSHSLTO-UHFFFAOYSA-N 3346 #> 4 56-23-5 35000.000000 VZGDMQKNWNREIO-UHFFFAOYSA-N 5943 #> 5 56-38-2     1.539119 LCCNCVORNKJIRZ-UHFFFAOYSA-N  991 #> 6 57-74-9    98.400000 BIWJNBZANLAXMG-UHFFFAOYSA-N 5993

title: Getting started with webchem
text: Functions query chemical information databases begin prefix matches database. example, functions query PubChem begin pc_ functions query ChemSpider begin cs_. example, ’ll get names log octanol/water partitioning coefficients compound using PubChem, number aromatic rings within chemical structure using ChEMBL. IUPAC names long unwieldy, one use pc_synonyms() choose better names. Several functions return synonyms well, even though explicitly translator type functions. ’ll see example next. Many chemical databases webchem can query contain vast amounts information variety structures. Therefore, webchem functions return nested lists rather data frames. chembl_query() one function. look entries ChEMBL need ChEMBL ID-s. can found PubChem page compound within ChEMBL ID section can programmatically retrieved using pc_sect(). nested list can inspect View(). element query, within query, many elements corresponding different properties database. extract single property queries, need use mapping function sapply().
code: y <- pc_prop(lc50_sub2$cid, properties = c("IUPACName", "XLogP")) y$CID <- as.character(y$CID) lc50_sub3 <- full_join(lc50_sub2, y, by = c("cid" = "CID")) head(lc50_sub3) #>       cas        value                    inchikey  cid #> 1 50-29-3    12.415277 YVGGHNCTFXOJCH-UHFFFAOYSA-N 3036 #> 2 52-68-6     1.282980 NFACJZMKEDPNKN-UHFFFAOYSA-N 5853 #> 3 55-38-9    12.168138 PNVJTZOFSHSLTO-UHFFFAOYSA-N 3346 #> 4 56-23-5 35000.000000 VZGDMQKNWNREIO-UHFFFAOYSA-N 5943 #> 5 56-38-2     1.539119 LCCNCVORNKJIRZ-UHFFFAOYSA-N  991 #> 6 57-74-9    98.400000 BIWJNBZANLAXMG-UHFFFAOYSA-N 5993 #>                                                                      IUPACName #> 1                  1-chloro-4-[2,2,2-trichloro-1-(4-chlorophenyl)ethyl]benzene #> 2                                 2,2,2-trichloro-1-dimethoxyphosphorylethanol #> 3 dimethoxy-(3-methyl-4-methylsulfanylphenoxy)-sulfanylidene-lambda5-phosphane #> 4                                                           tetrachloromethane #> 5                    diethoxy-(4-nitrophenoxy)-sulfanylidene-lambda5-phosphane #> 6                    1,3,4,7,8,9,10,10-octachlorotricyclo[5.2.1.02,6]dec-8-ene #>   XLogP #> 1   6.9 #> 2   0.5 #> 3   4.1 #> 4   2.8 #> 5   3.8 #> 6   4.9 lc50_sub3$chembl_id <- pc_sect(x$cid, "ChEMBL ID")$Result out <- chembl_query(lc50_sub3$chembl_id, verbose = FALSE) lc50_sub3$aromatic_rings <- sapply(out, function(y) {   # return NA if entry cannot be found in ChEMBL   if (length(y) == 1 && is.na(y)) return(NA)   # return the number of aromatic rings   y$molecule_properties$aromatic_rings }) lc50_sub3$common_name <- sapply(out, function(y) {   # return NA if entry cannot be found in ChEMBL   if (length(y) == 1 && is.na(y)) return(NA)   # return preferred name   ifelse(!is.null(y$pref_name), y$pref_name, NA) }) #tidy up columns lc50_done <- dplyr::select(lc50_sub3, common_name, cas, inchikey, XLogP, aromatic_rings) head(lc50_done) #>            common_name     cas                    inchikey XLogP aromatic_rings #> 1     CHLOROPHENOTHANE 50-29-3 YVGGHNCTFXOJCH-UHFFFAOYSA-N   6.9              2 #> 2          TRICHLORFON 52-68-6 NFACJZMKEDPNKN-UHFFFAOYSA-N   0.5              0 #> 3             FENTHION 55-38-9 PNVJTZOFSHSLTO-UHFFFAOYSA-N   4.1              1 #> 4 CARBON TETRACHLORIDE 56-23-5 VZGDMQKNWNREIO-UHFFFAOYSA-N   2.8              0 #> 5            PARATHION 56-38-2 LCCNCVORNKJIRZ-UHFFFAOYSA-N   3.8              1 #> 6            CHLORDANE 57-74-9 BIWJNBZANLAXMG-UHFFFAOYSA-N   4.9              0

title: Query Chemical Identifier Resolver — cir_query
text: CIR can resolve can following identifier: Chemical Names,  IUPAC names,  CAS Numbers, SMILES strings, IUPAC InChI/InChIKeys, NCI/CADD Identifiers,  CACTVS HASHISY, NSC number, PubChem SID, ZINC Code, ChemSpider ID,  ChemNavigator SID, eMolecule VID. cir_query() can handle part possible conversions CIR.  Possible representations : 'smiles'(SMILES strings), 'names' (Names), 'cas' (CAS numbers), 'stdinchikey' (Standard InChIKey), 'stdinchi' (Standard InChI), 'ficts' (FICTS Identifier), 'ficus' (FICuS Indetifier), 'uuuuu' (uuuuu Identifier), 'mw' (Molecular weight), 'monoisotopic_mass' (Monoisotopic Mass), 'formula' (Chemical Formula), 'chemspider_id' (ChemSpider ID), 'pubchem_sid' (PubChem SID), 'chemnavigator_sid' (ChemNavigator SID), 'h_bond_donor_count' (Number Hydrogen Bond Donors), 'h_bond_acceptor_count' (Number Hydrogen Bond Acceptors), 'h_bond_center_count' (Number Hydrogen Bond Centers), 'rule_of_5_violation_count' (Number Rule 5 Violations), 'rotor_count' (Number Freely Rotatable Bonds), 'effective_rotor_count' (Number Effectively Rotatable Bonds), 'ring_count' (Number Rings), 'ringsys_count' (Number Ring Systems), 'xlogp2' (octanol-water partition coefficient), 'aromatic' (compound aromatic), 'macrocyclic' (compound macrocyclic), 'heteroatom_count' (heteroatom count), 'hydrogen_atom_count' (H atom count), 'heavy_atom_count' ( Heavy atom count), 'deprotonable_group_count' (Number deprotonable groups), 'protonable_group_count' (Number protonable groups). CIR first tries determine identifier type submitted  uses 'resolvers' look data.  resolver supplied, CIR tries different resolvers  turn till hit found.  E.g. names CIR tries first look OPSIN fails  local name index CIR.  However, can also specified resolvers use  (know e.g. know identifier type)  Possible resolvers : 'name_by_cir' (Lookup name index CIR), 'name_by_opsin' (Lookup OPSIN), 'name_by_chemspider' (Lookup ChemSpider,    https://cactus.nci.nih.gov/blog/?p=1386), 'smiles' (Lookup SMILES), 'stdinchikey', 'stdinchi' (InChI), 'cas_number' (CAS Number), 'name_pattern' (Google-like pattern search    (https://cactus.nci.nih.gov/blog/?p=1456)    Note, pattern search can combined resolvers,    e.g. resolver = 'name_by_chemspider,name_pattern'.

title: Query Chemical Identifier Resolver — cir_query
text: can make 1 request per second (hard-coded feature).

title: Query Chemical Identifier Resolver — cir_query
text: cir relies great CIR web service created CADD Group NCI/NIH! https://cactus.nci.nih.gov/chemical/structure_documentation, https://cactus.nci.nih.gov/blog/?cat=10, https://cactus.nci.nih.gov/blog/?p=1386, https://cactus.nci.nih.gov/blog/?p=1456,

title: Query Chemical Identifier Resolver — cir_query
code: if (FALSE) { # might fail if API is not available cir_query("Triclosan", "cas") cir_query("3380-34-5", "cas", match = "first") cir_query("3380-34-5", "cas", resolver = "cas_number") cir_query("3380-34-5", "smiles") cir_query("Triclosan", "mw")  # multiple inputs comp <- c("Triclosan", "Aspirin") cir_query(comp, "cas", match = "first")  }

title: Retrieve Pubchem Compound ID (CID) — get_cid

Depositor names case sensitive. Depositor names Data Source IDs can found https://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sources/. <assay target> assembled "target/{gi | proteinname | geneid | genesymbol | accession}", e.g. = "target/geneid" query GeneID.

code: if (FALSE) { # might fail if API is not available get_cid("Triclosan") get_cid("Triclosan", arg = "name_type=word") # from SMILES get_cid("CCCC", from = "smiles") # from InChI get_cid("InChI=1S/CH5N/c1-2/h2H2,1H3", from = "inchi") # from InChIKey get_cid("BPGDAMSIGCZZLK-UHFFFAOYSA-N", from = "inchikey") # from formula get_cid("C26H52NO6P", from = "formula") # from CAS RN get_cid("56-40-6", from = "xref/rn") # similarity get_cid(5564, from = "similarity/cid") get_cid("CCO", from = "similarity/smiles") # from SID get_cid("126534046", from = "sid", domain = "substance") # sourceid get_cid("VCC957895", from = "sourceid/23706", domain = "substance") # sourceall get_cid("Optopharma Ltd", from = "sourceall", domain = "substance") # from AID (CIDs of substances tested in the assay) get_cid(170004, from = "aid", domain = "assay") # from GeneID (CIDs of substances tested on the gene) get_cid(25086, from = "target/geneid", domain = "assay")  # multiple inputs get_cid(c("Triclosan", "Aspirin"))  }

what: Retrieve retention indices from NIST — nist_ri
title: Retrieve retention indices from NIST — nist_ri
text: function scrapes NIST literature retention indices   given query vector queries input. query can cas   number, IUPAC name, International Chemical Identifier (inchikey),   according value argument. Retention indices   stored tables type, polarity temperature program   (temp_prog). function can take multiple arguments   parameters return retention times matching specified   criteria single table. non-cas query provided, function try resolve query   searching NIST WebBook corresponding CAS number.   == "name", phonetic spellings Greek stereo-descriptors   (e.g. "alpha", "beta", "gamma") automatically   converted corresponding letters match form used NIST.   CAS number found, returned tibble   corresponding information NIST retention index database.

title: Retrieve retention indices from NIST — nist_ri
code: nist_ri(   query,   from = c("cas", "inchi", "inchikey", "name"),   type = c("kovats", "linear", "alkane", "lee"),   polarity = c("polar", "non-polar"),   temp_prog = c("isothermal", "ramp", "custom"),   cas = NULL,   verbose = getOption("verbose") )

title: Retrieve retention indices from NIST — nist_ri
text: query character; search term character; type search term. can one "name", "inchi", "inchikey", "cas". Using identifier preferred "name" since NA returned event multiple matches query. Using identifier CAS number cause function run slower CAS numbers used internal identifiers NIST. type Retention index type: "kovats", "linear", "alkane", /"lee". See details . polarity Column polarity: "polar" /"non-polar" get RIs calculated polar non-polar columns. temp_prog Temperature program: "isothermal", "ramp", /"custom". cas deprecated.  Use query instead. verbose logical; verbose output printed console?

title: Retrieve retention indices from NIST — nist_ri
text: returns tibble literature RIs following columns: query query provided NIST server cas CAS number unique record identified used NIST RI retention index type type RI (e.g. "kovats", "linear", "alkane", "lee") polarity polarity column (either "polar" "non-polar") temp_prog type temperature program (e.g. "isothermal", "ramp", "custom") column column type, e.g. "capillary" phase stationary phase (column phase) length column length meters gas carrier gas used substrate diameter column diameter mm thickness phase thickness µm program. various columns depending value temp_prog reference retention index published comment. believe denotes database data       aggregated

title: Retrieve retention indices from NIST — nist_ri
text: types retention indices included NIST include Kovats   ("kovats"), Van den Dool Kratz ("linear"), normal alkane   ("alkane"), Lee ("lee"). Details   calculated available NIST website:   https://webbook.nist.gov/chemistry/gc-ri/

title: Parse Molfile (as returned by ChemSpider) into a R-object. — parse_mol
text: list four entries: header (eh), counts line (cl), atom block (ab) bond block (bb). header: = number atoms, b = number bonds, l = number atom lists, f = obsolete, c = chiral flag (0=chiral, 1 = chiral), s = number stext entries, x, r, p, = obsolete, m = 999, v0 version atom block: x, y, z = atom coordinates, = mass difference, c= charge, s= stereo parity, h = hydrogen count 1, b = stereo care box, v = valence, h = h0 designator, r, = used, m = atom-atom mapping number, n = inversion/retention flag, e = exact change flag bond block: 1 = first atom, 2 = second atom, t = bond type, s = stereo type, x = used, r = bond typology, c = reacting center status.

title: Export a Chemical Structure in .mol Format. — write_mol
code: if (FALSE) { # export Mol file csid <- get_csid("bergapten") mol3d <- cs_compinfo(csid$csid, field = "Mol3D") write_mol(mol3d$mol3D, file = mol3d$id)  # export multiple Mol files csids <- get_csid(c("bergapten", "xanthotoxin")) mol3ds <- cs_compinfo(csids$csid, field = "Mol3D") mapply(function(x, y) write_mol(x, y), x = mol3ds$mol3D, y = mol3ds$id) }

text: cts_convert() ignore ‘first’ argument. get_csid() return NA, problem API. Many functions returned ‘NA2+’ NA given - now return NA default. Many fixes NA handling, e.g. hit found.
